weekly_top_story.headline: FDA Clears Cryoablation System for Early-Stage Breast Cancer in Older Adults
weekly_top_story.summary: The FDA granted marketing authorization for the ProSense Cryoablation System, a minimally invasive device that freezes small, early-stage breast cancers in women 70+ not suitable for surgery, offering a new treatment option for this patient group.

stories.headline: Senate Special Committee on Aging to Hold Hearing on 'Bad Medicine: Closing Loopholes that Kill American Patients'
stories.summary: The Senate Special Committee on Aging will hold a hearing on October 8, 2025, to discuss regulatory loopholes contributing to preventable patient deaths, a critical issue for drug safety and patient care.

stories.headline: India Probes Contaminated Cough Syrup Linked to At Least 14 Child Deaths
stories.summary: Indian authorities launched a criminal investigation after at least 14 children died from consuming contaminated cough syrup in Madhya Pradesh, highlighting ongoing concerns about global pharmaceutical quality control.

stories.headline: AstraZeneca’s Datroway Shows Improved Survival in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer
stories.summary: AstraZeneca announced that Datroway, a drug co-developed with Daiichi Sankyo, significantly improved survival and delayed disease progression in patients with advanced, inoperable triple-negative breast cancer who are ineligible for immunotherapy.
